TopicTitle: [1.12.x] Malah's Quick Mods - ZEROMINIAVC in new thread

Articles.Content:
OK... Here how I got the error:

  1. fresh KSP 1.10.1 install (cloned with CKAN from base Steam install)
  2. install QuickStart 2.2.0.10 with CKAN, which installs dependencies CTB, toolbar controller and Zero MiniVAC
  3. launch KSP, disable QS and start new sandbox career
  4. Go to VAB
  5. Place command pod (not time sensitive)
  6. delete part (drag and drop it on part menu, not time sensitive)
  7. wait
  8. 4 "frustum" errors appear in <= 30 sec. and then repeat every 30 sec.

Notes:

  1. Going to the VAB and doing nothing (skipping #5 and #6) does NOT produce errors.  
  2. Creating a new ship, instead of deleting the part at step 6, does NOT produce errors

Yeah, sorry I wasn't careful enough in my description before. It's very obscure. I only got a subsequent null ref that one time I posted above when I couldn't select a part. Otherwise it seemed to have no effect.

On 4/30/2018 at 2:14 PM, linuxgurugamer said:
  • QuickRevert : Revert keeper
  •  

A bit vague.

7 hours ago, Bej Kerman said:

A bit vague.

 

On 4/30/2018 at 3:14 PM, linuxgurugamer said:

The original thread is here, please look at it for detailed instructions: https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/85834-130-malahs-quick-mods-20170531/

I would like to know if the Quick Sas Mod is working.
I installed it but nothing happens. Maybe I'm doing something wrong?

On 2/23/2021 at 4:46 PM, frankieorabona said:

I would like to know if the Quick Sas Mod is working.
I installed it but nothing happens. Maybe I'm doing something wrong?

I just tested Quick SAS and it seems to be working fine.

Configuration: Windows 10 x64 | KSP 1.10.0.2917 | Clean KSP install with just Quick SAS and it's dependencies. | Quick SAS 1.2.0.7

Please note, that Quick SAS has dependencies: ClickThroughBlocker, ToolbarController,  Zero MiniAVC (dependency of ToolbarController) so make sure you have those installed.

You can install the mod through CKAN to make sure those dependencies are met.

Also note that the Quick SAS toolbar button which is used for configuration of the keybindings is only available in the main Space Center scene.

Edited February 24, 2021 by ronillon

Thanks for the help.
In fact, Zero MiniAVC was not installed. Now I can see the mod but I have another problem
But now I am experiencing this problem. USB controller inputs cannot be set. It only accepts keyboard input.

I have the same problem! 

USB controller inputs cannot be set...there is no one who can solve this problem?

On 2/24/2021 at 11:07 AM, frankieorabona said:

But now I am experiencing this problem. USB controller inputs cannot be set. It only accepts keyboard input. 

 

10 hours ago, ricina_frank said:

I have the same problem! 

USB controller inputs cannot be set...there is no one who can solve this problem?

Why not just map your controller inputs to the appropriate keyboard keys?

3 hours ago, leatherneck6017 said:

Why not just map your controller inputs to the appropriate keyboard keys?

The reason could be wanting more keys, than just what he has available on his keyboad. Otherwise I agree, controller-keyboard chain mapping is the easiest way to go.

Although I hardly use half of my keyboard keys myself in KSP, I can imagine someone wanting more, it all depends on playstyle I guess.

For example I'm playing this other space game, where although you can manage with keyboard+mouse with clever modkeys, it would be much more convenient to have 2-3 full keyboards, couple hotas, mouse and touchscreen or two.

17 hours ago, leatherneck6017 said:

 

Why not just map your controller inputs to the appropriate keyboard keys?

Because there are no keys available...
I use a custom controller... associating 10 keys to the controller means reprogramming my entire configuration...

51 minutes ago, frankieorabona said:

Because there are no keys available...
I use a custom controller... associating 10 keys to the controller means reprogramming my entire configuration...

Have you looked at AFBW?  It might be able to do what you want, not sure
Thanks for the tip ... I'll have a look at it right away ...

Aight, so i have this game breaking glitch with MINIAVC where it pops up saying that EL launchpads is out of date, and only EL. Even though i have other outdated mods. and whenever KSP fully boots up i cant close the window, but i deleted ALL files related to MiniAVC and i even dowloaded zeroMiniAVC!

I can close it when KSP is loading

Screenshots and a log coming soon, i need KSP to fully boot up for a full log

Log: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EdiTmml6Oyys_Q4J2vXD5ldHubVU1ktp/view?usp=sharing

Video: https://imgur.com/a/ZP3GNw1

One small issue on Quick Goto: the LVES is not consistently going to the last vessel. It might go to the second prior one or some other random place. Once it jumped to an asteroid that I was tracking but had not visited. So that's a minor spoiler. Sorry I don't have logs now. There was no in game error. I can try to reproduce it with logs... but it might not show anything. 

I'm running 1.4.0.8 on KSP 1.11.2 now. Saw this on earlier 1.11 versions and maybe 1.10 - not sure.

Edited March 21, 2021 by Krazy1

Your log shows that you don't have any MiniAVC dlls there.

Why do you assume it's a MiniAVC error?

From the log file: 

[LOG 04:23:28.951] [AddonLoader]: Instantiating addon 'CompatibilityChecker' from assembly 'Launchpad'

[LOG 04:23:29.619] [AddonLoader]: Instantiating addon 'CompatibilityChecker' from assembly 'Kopernicus'

[LOG 04:23:30.069] [AddonLoader]: Instantiating addon 'CompatibilityChecker' from assembly 'ProceduralParts'

[WRN 04:25:26.850] [CompatibilityChecker] Incompatible mods detected: Launchpad

Looks like you have an old version of LaunchPad installed (probably EPL).

Well, why didn't you post the entries from the log which I showed you in the EL thread?  They can only respond to what you post.

Your first mistake was incorrectly identifying MiniAVC as the culprit, so of course they would send you over here.   

Your second mistake was not posting the log files there, and your third mistake was posting a totally incomprehensible post without any information there.

I've done you the favor and posted the relevant information there for you.  I suggest that you apologize there for the misdirection, etc.

@linuxgurugamer Can you do me a favor and confirm a Unity crash with QuickStart and QuickExit on 1.12.1? I was hoping to keep using these older mods for QoL purposes. 

You are going to call me crazy but I've spent better part of the past three days tracking down which mod is causing an unspecified Unity crash, and these were the last two I removed to see if it was the cause. The crash is occurring in the VAB at random, whether clicking and moving parts/windows or just sitting there. I removed those two mods and have been sitting in the VAB randomly clicking away trying to force another Unity crash for the past hour and thus far all seems stable. So only variable I can find right now is QuickStart and QuickExit.

Last Unity crash logs located at the following link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1eiI1xjqE_xjxgjgVHN3nVynpIBMDxwSF/view?usp=sharing

Ok, maybe something else going on with my installation then. Went to breakfast and just got back and still sitting just fine at the VAB, no Unity crash. Everything was installed via latest version of CKAN, including overriding the version check on both QuickStart and QuickExit. I'm going to start rolling some mods back in and see if I can force another Unity crash. I frankly can't believe its either QS or QE either but here I am...

If you have procedural fairings installed, it's broken in 1.12 and causing CTDs

New release,  1.4.0.8

  • QuickStart 2.2.1
    • Added line written to log showing total time from startup to the MainMenu
    • Fixed edge case in editor causing a CTD:
  1. Create new ship and add root part
  2. Delete root part
  3. Wait for next save
  • Added AssemblyFileVersion

 

  • All of the following:
  • QuickBrake 1.4.0.8
  • QuickContracts 1.3.0.8
  • QuickCursorHider 1.1.0.7
  • QuickExit 2.2.0.8
  • QuickFineControl 1.1.0.7
  • QuickGoTo 1.4.0.9
  • QuickHide 3.3.0.9
  • QuickIVA 1.3.0.8
  • QuickMute 1.4.0.7
  • QuickRevert 3.2.0.8
  • QuickSAS 1.2.0.8
  • QuickSearch 3.3.0.11
    • Added AssemblyFileVersion
